topics.body:
I propose that March 7th no longer be known as Women's Rights Day, as I feel it has done nothing to promote gender equality and instead only causes fuss over the definition of equality. Therefore, I move that come Baseball Season we celebrate Hitter Day. A unisex, multi-racial, multi-cultural communal experience in which we legally close work for a day. Combined with special deals at the park to make the games accessible for all incomes we - as a single community - enjoy the community bonding experience of Baseball... Or some other contact sport.

Because where the neckbeards cry in pain over no Men's Rights Days, and the legbeards rise in protest of this, it can be safe to assume National Women's Day doesn't do much in the same of solving sexism. As Morgan Freeman said about Racism when it comes to black vs white and black history month: it just further highlights the personal difference between people.


So, let's celebrate unity with the crack of a bat, shit beer, and generic hotdogs.
topics.author: 4fe4bf947f123b175b000001

topics.body:
Going back to me finally getting around to star ocean: the last hope:
Sweet fucking christ I finally managed to keep my brain inside my skull long enough to get through it.  If it was a reboot of the series fine, but the fact that it's a canon prequel doesn't make any fucking sense.

The number of timeline paradoxes.  The number of times they tried to tie in the timeline by wanking off the previous games.  The number of times they went, "I know this doesn't make any sense, but here we are masturbating off the previous games.  Jacking off the previous games stories makes this good right? . . Right? . . right?"
I can feel my brain catching fire from how bad the story is.
*AHHHHH*
(insert scanners movie clip of that dude's head catching fire)


The game is good, it's just the story.  It's like if the star trek reboot was canon to the original timeline.


Well fuck no wonder why the game's story is so fucking bad; it's by the same company that made final fantasy 13.

Was there gold hidden in the village? Silver, gems? Was there more food? Where is Lord Beric? Which of the village folk had aided him? When he rode off, where did he go? How many men were with them? How many knights, how many bowmen, how many men-at-arms?
